name: ticked

past simple and past participle of
tick
tick verb
(SOUND)
C2 [ I ] When a clock or watch ticks, it makes a sound every second: The ticking of the clock kept her awake.

tick verb
(MARK)
A1 [ T ] UK (US usually check) to mark something with a tick: Tick (off) each item on the list as you complete it.
